arts.ttl: Cheltenham Town v Doncaster Rovers RECAP: Late goals sink Robins
arts.sum: Liam Kinsella had to make a clearance off the line for Cheltenham, while Jordan Gibson crashed a shot against the bar for Grant McCann's Doncaster just after Dieng's red card. Both teams had chances to break the deadlock, with Dieng flicking Tom Bradbury's cross wide early on and Jordan Thomas sending a shot just past the right post before half-time.

arts.ttl: Late Jamie Sterry and Rob Street goals earn Doncaster win at 10-man Cheltenham
arts.sum: Sterry applied the perfect touch and strike past Joe Day in the 89th minute, while Street finished neatly in the fifth minute of stoppage-time.

arts.ttl: Cheltenham Town striker Matty Taylor's story so far
arts.sum: Taylor swiftly moved on to Old Woodstock Town of Hellenic League Division One. After impressing in half a season there, he was invited back to Oxford United on trial and signed for them as a second year scholar. It was at that point, in the summer of 2014, that Darrell Clarke signed Taylor for the first of three times, taking him to a Bristol Rovers team that had just been relegated from the EFL.

arts.ttl: Home truths, lack of communication and "embarrassing goals" - Cheltenham Town boss Michael Flynn after Morecambe defeat - Gloucestershire Live
arts.sum: It's been creeping in now, three or four games where we are making a lot of individual errors, cost us at one end and we don't look like scoring at the other - that's three games in a row now so the proof is in the pudding. There was only one out, 2 v 1 I don't mind that, players making the decisions on the pitch, but the way we passed it to get a ball in the box was too slow, not enough quality on the pass in.
